byline.original: By George Whitmore; George Whitmore is a freelance journalist and the author of ''Nebraska,'' a novel. This article was adapted from ''Someone Was Here,'' a book of reportage on the AIDS epidemic, to be published by New American Library in April.  And we go,  And we drop like the fruits of  the tree,  Even we,  Even so.  -George Meredith  ''Dirge in Woods''

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THREE YEARS ago, when I suggested an article to the editors of this magazine on ''the human cost of AIDS,'' most reporting on the epidemic was scientific in nature and people with AIDS were often portrayed as faceless victims. By profiling a man with AIDS and his volunteer counselor from Gay Men's Health Crisis, I proposed to show the devastating impact AIDS was having on a few individual lives.
